node.text:
Much like the climate crisis, the plastic problem that exist today on Earth, seems gargantuan in nature. Humanity has created these problems, and it is humanity that will find a solution to them.

Plastic now pervades every part of our lives. It is in our food, our water, and it even falls from the sky in some parts of the world in the form of micro plastics.

Plastic has even reached the deepest trenches of the oceans of Earth. 🌊🌎

Some say that by 2050, there will be more plastic in the ocean and there will be fish. 🐟

So what can we do about it?

⭐️ Stop eating fish, 46% of ocean plastics are discarded fishing nets. 
⭐️ Recycle
⭐️ Upcycle
⭐️ Reuse
⭐️ Petition your local political leaders to ban single use plastic items.
⭐️ Education is key
⭐️ Volunteer for beach clean ups

What are your tips for reducing your plastic use?

Video featuring @joshwideawake and @robbie_lockie

node.text:
Today is International Orangutan Day. 🦧 One of our closest relatives on Earth is being pushed to the brink of extinction, just so we can enjoy our favorite products.

This banned TV AD from UK Supermarket Iceland (@icelandfoods), made by @greenpeace illustrates the reality of palm oil farming.

Orangutans have declined by around 50% in the last 60 years and today they’re only found on two islands – Sumatra and Borneo. Despite once roaming as far north as southern China, and as far south as the Indonesian island of Java.

Illegal logging, mining, hunting and the pet trade are all very serious issues for the remaining populations of Orangutan. However the biggest cause of habitat loss and therefore the decline in Orangutan numbers is palm oil. Palm oil is found in around 50% of items in your supermarket.

Where you can, avoid products containing UNSUSTAINABLE palm oil, and instead, opt for Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO) - as this is the most efficient oil we can forest. If we all switched to other oils deforestation would INCREASE, so opt for sustainable palm oil where possible.

node.text:
Join me @robbie_lockie for this live Q&A with Jen Stojkovic founder of @veganwomensummit 

Vegan Women Summit™ (VWS) is a global events and media organization created to empower female-identifying change makers to bring compassion to their careers. VWS hosts events with the goal to foster a community of strong, ambitious rising leaders working to build a kinder, more sustainable world. VWS is supported by leading CEOs, venture capitalists, artists, athletes, & nonprofit leaders from around the world.

VWS strives to provide an inclusive environment for all and defines “women” and “female” as including all individuals who identify, have identified, or have been identified as women or female. Attendees of all backgrounds, including all genders, are invited to participate in VWS events. 

Find out more at https://veganwomensummit.com

node.text:
@madeinhackney Made In Hackney opened its doors in 2012 as the UK’s first fully vegan community cookery school and charity.

They collaborate with communities to showcase and develop skills, knowledge and inspiration to grow, cook and eat more plants.

The kitchen started as a response to global and local crisis – health inequalities, food access and climate change. These interconnected issues drive their mission to bring about positive change in the areas of community, health and environment with delicious, culturally varied, nutritious plant-based food at the centre of all they do.

The heartbeat of their organisation is their cookery and food growing classes. These sessions are opportunities to come together, share skills and cultural cuisines, learn new ones, deepen community connection and inspire joyful and lasting behaviour change. The results of these gatherings are beautiful.

From curing type 2 diabetes, healing chronic bowel disorders, improving chronic fatigue symptoms, helping to manage depression, forming new friendships, starting a window ledge garden, gaining the skills and confidence to start a food business or learning to cook for the first time age 82 – the MIH family members unique journey’s after participating in their programmes never cease to amaze and inspire.

Find out more at https://madeinhackney.org/

node.text:
⚠️ Video contains graphic footage ⚠️

Whaling has taken place in the Faroe Islands for the past 1,000 years.

Every year, an annual hunt known as ‘the grind’ takes place between June - September at any one of the 26 designated killing bays around the islands.

On June 27th, @seashepherd crew witnessed 175 pilot whales be brutally killed in the name of this barbaric tradition. The dead included juveniles and pregnant females, who’s almost fully formed foetuses were discarded as trash.

Visit plnt.news/faroeislands (link in stories) to read more on this topic, or visit @seashepherd to find out how you can help put an end to it.

node.text:
Since @gretathunberg first appeared on the world’s stage, she has sounded the alarm over what will make Covid-19 look like a walk in the park. Climate breakdown is happening NOW.

People are not only quick to put Greta down, but speak of her in such unjustified and unforgivable ways.

Some of the following are examples of the narratives people believe;

✅ Greta is being controlled by the media
✅ Greta doesn’t write her own scripts and is a puppet
✅ George Soros made her
✅ Greta is a child and can’t possibly be thinking for herself

And then there are all the sexist, hateful, misogynistic commentary which we can not repeat. Most of these born out of a toxic sexist narrative from a society that can not understand how a young woman could be so intelligent. Greta is 18 years old. She is an adult.

If Greta was male, she wouldn’t receive a fraction of the hate she gets today. Society  pretends to be equal in how men and woman are treated, but that is simply not true. An illusion built and upheld by our patriarchal society. Women have been undermined, railroaded, gaslight, raped, abused, under-funded, under represented for centuries.

Greta’s message is one of extreme urgency, we are living on borrowed time. Our leaders have failed us. They need to start listening.

Or we are all f*cked.

Words by @robbie_lockie

node.title: Speaking Truth To Power Takes Guts

node.text:
🔊SOUND ON 🔊
We are in the midst of an environmental emergency. Our forests are burning, our air is being polluted, our oceans are being poisoned, our soil degraded, and our wildlife wiped out. Never before in human history have we seen ecological devastation on this scale.  If we don’t act soon there won’t be a future to fight for.

Animal farming is at the heart of the climate crisis. Animal products provide just 18 per cent of calories while taking up 83 per cent of all farmland and produces 60 per cent of agriculture’s greenhouse gas emissions. We could reduce the use of farmland by over 75 per cent if we adopted a vegan diet. In 2018, the most comprehensive analysis of agriculture ever conducted, led by the University of Oxford, found overwhelmingly that the ‘single biggest way’ that individuals can protect the planet and our future is to adopt a vegan lifestyle.

The impact of eating animal products reaches far beyond the cow that you’re eating. It is contributing to the world’s sixth mass extinction and hurtling us towards a catastrophic temperature rise of up to 5°C by the end of this century.

Time is running out. Runaway climate change and habitat destruction have become THE most profound challenges of our age. We still have time left before we pass the point of no-return if we ACT NOW.

Going vegan is the single biggest thing you can do to cut down your environmental impact. Start your journey today.

Search Google for “Vegan Now” or follow @vivacharity to find out more.

Our food system is collapsing around us, and some farming practices are destroying the precious soil we have left. It’s time to start focusing on solutions. 🌱

Watch @rosariodawson’s award-winning film, @theneedtogrow for free via this link 👉 plnt.news/needtogrow (clickable in IGTV) or swipe up on our stories!

node.text:
Dr Gemma Newman is a sparkling light in the medical field. She speaks from a point of knowledge and wisdom as well as making it easy to digest. The Plant Power Doctor is packed full of leading science in a very accessible way and lots of beautiful recipes too. -- David Flynn and Stephen Flynn The Happy Pear

Dr Gemma is delightful and whip-smart. May you be equal parts entertained and enlightened by her welcoming presence. -- Rich Roll

Dr Gemma is one of the few brave voices in the medical community who is experienced, courageous and confident enough to talk openly about food and its significance in preventing disease to save lives. What you choose to put on your plate is one of the most important health interventions and more plants is certainly the message we all need to hear. This book is a fantastic resource for people looking to improve their wellbeing and I'm personally inspired by Gemma's resilience and effort. -- Dr Rupy Aujla (Bestselling author and founder of The Doctor's Kitchen)

A must read for everyone. Food really can be medicine and Gemma shows you how. -- Dr Shireen Kassam (Consultant Haematologist, Founder of Plant Based Health Professionals UK)

Plant Power Doctor lays the foundation for a lifetime of good health and happiness - for both your mind and body. -- Rohini Bajekal (Nutritionist and Board-
Certified Lifestyle Medicine Professional)

An accessible resource, and one that is overflowing with practical, life-saving information. -- Brenda Davis (Research Dietitian)

Dr Newman is one of the few doctors who truly understands how to keep people healthy - instead of just treating them when they're sick. Her terrific Plant Power Doctor should be on the bookshelves of everyone who wants to live a longer, better life. -- Dan Buettner (New York Times Bestselling author of The Blue Zones)

Knowledge is power and so are plant-based foods! Thanks for making it so easy to understand. -- Derek Sarno (Wicked Kitchen co-founder and author)
One of a new wave of GPs who prescribe lifestyle changes as well as drugs. * The Telegraph *

node.title: The Plant Power Doctor - Dr Gemma Newman

node.text:
Join PBN cofounder @robbie_lockie for this quick LIVE with @nomeatathlete_official and @robert.cheeke to discuss their new book The Plant-Based Athlete. 

The book is 39% off for only $17.74! That price drop happened this morning on Amazon. 

The only research-based guide for connecting a plant-based diet with peak athletic performance, featuring interviews with professional athletes who've made the switch from meat to plants.

The Plant-Based Athlete by Matt Frazier and Robert Cheeke reveals the incontrovertible proof that the human body does not need meat, eggs, or dairy to be strong. Instead, research shows that a consciously calibrated plant-based diet offers the greatest possible recovery times, cell oxidation, injury prevention, and restorative sleep, and allows athletes to train more effectively, with better results.

However, committing to a plant-based diet as an elite athlete, first-time marathoner, or weekend warrior isn't as simple as swapping vegetables for meat. Even the slightest food adjustments can impact performance. That's why Matt Frazier, founder of No Meat Athlete, and Robert Cheeke, founder of Vegan Bodybuilding, wrote this groundbreaking book, to guide those interested in making this important shift in how to do so with the best, most transformative results.

The Plant-Based Athlete offers readers:

A persuasive body of evidence for adopting a plant-based lifestyle, with key information about how macronutrients, micronutrients, and calories fuel a body running on plant foods
An entire chapter devoted to protein - why plant sources of protein are preferable over meat, and how plant protein can be used to increase strength, muscle mass, and power
60+ delicious and nutritious plant-based recipes, including Veggie Burger Patties, Garden Meatballs, Summer Pasta Salad, Vegan Mac & Cheese, French Toast, Acai Bowl, and a High-Energy Smoothie
Insights from winning plant-based athletes in nearly every sport including champion ultrarunners Rich Roll and Scott Jurek; former NFL player David Carter; champion boxers Yuri Foreman, Unsal Arik, Cam Awesome, and Vanessa Espinoza; and Olympic-level swimmers, cyclists, figure skaters, sprinters, and more.

node.title: ❤️‍🔥BOOM! ❤️‍🔥 The Plant-Based Athlete IS OUT NOW!

node.text:
Much like the climate crisis, the plastic problem that exist today on Earth, seems gargantuan in nature. Humanity has created these problems, and it is humanity that will find a solution to them.

Plastic now pervades every part of our lives. It is in our food, our water, and it even falls from the sky in some parts of the world in the form of micro plastics.

Plastic has even reached the deepest trenches of the oceans of Earth. 🌊🌎

Some say that by 2050, there will be more plastic in the ocean and there will be fish. 🐟

So what can we do about it?

⭐️ Stop eating fish, 46% of ocean plastics are discarded fishing nets. 
⭐️ Recycle
⭐️ Upcycle
⭐️ Reuse
⭐️ Petition your local political leaders to ban single use plastic items.
⭐️ Education is key
⭐️ Volunteer for beach clean ups

What are your tips for reducing your plastic use?

Video featuring @joshwideawake and @robbie_lockie

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Plant Based News on August 29, 2021 tagging @justveganfacts. May be an image of text that says 'GOT MILK? (A.K.A. BABY COW GROWTH HORMONE FLUID) THE LIFE OF A DAIRY COW EXPLAINED @justveganfacts'.

node.text:
The dairy industry; explained. 🐄 

Contrary to popular belief, cows, like all other mammals, only produce milk after giving birth. This prompts farmers to artificially inseminate their cows each year. Typically, a dairy cow will be impregnated up to 6 times. Then, when her body can no longer produce babies or milk (in the UK this is usually around 6 years old), she is sent to slaughter for her meat. A cows’ natural lifespan is 20 years. 

Share these to your story ↖️ to raise awareness of the horrors that cows go through in order for us to have their milk in our coffee and cereal 🥣 

Graphics by @justveganfacts 

Take the 7-day dairy-free challenge from @worldplantmilkday and receive free support and tips along the way. Tap the link in our bio for more info!

https://plnt.news/WPMD2021

node.text:
This mother cow is chasing after her baby who is being taken away on a motorcycle. Risking her own safety on a busy road full of moving vehicles, the mother keeps running and running for her baby. This is what mother’s love looks like. This love is universal to most sentient beings.

On dairy farms, calves are separated from their moms so that the milk that’s naturally meant to nourish the baby can be sold to humans instead. 

By consuming dairy you’re paying for the destruction of motherhood. Please ditch dairy and go vegan for the animals. 

🎥 Vaibhav Tannirwar
👀 Spotted on @thesavemovement

node.text:
If milk cartons told the truth...🥛👀

The UN’s Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) has warned that a global temperature rise of 1.5C above pre-industrial levels is approaching.
Climate crisis symptoms could be irreversible without urgent intervention.

The IPCC’s ‘devastating’ new report – which details how climate breakdown is impacting the world – is its most comprehensive assessment to date (read more via the link in our bio).

In 2019, researchers from Oxford University conducted the most comprehensive analysis of farming’s impact on the planet to date. Joseph Poore, who led the study, concluded: “A vegan diet is probably the single biggest way to reduce your impact on planet Earth, not just greenhouse gases, but global acidification, eutrophication, land use and water use.”

We are already seeing the effects of the climate crisis take hold on our planet. We must address our food choices. Switch to plant-based milk instead of dairy.

Sign up to the 7 day dairy-free challenge with @worldplantmilkday 👈

These milk cartons were made in collaboration with our friends at @alt_dairy 

https://plantbasednews.org/news/environment/climate-crisis-devastating-report/

node.text:
For years, the meat and dairy industries have been trying to pass legislation to censor which words plant-based products can and can’t use - keeping vegan companies jumping through hoops.⠀
⠀
How about we get upset with turning an animal into a product, instead of upset about calling a white liquid made from oats ‘milk’? 👀🥛
